newsitem.title: USA: Photronics sets $90 mln note offer.
newsitem.headline: Photronics sets $90 mln note offer.

text.p: Photronics Inc said on Friday that it had begun an offering of $90 million in convertible subordinated notes due in 2004.
The notes will carry an interst rate of six percent semi-annually beginning December 1, 1997, and a conversion price of $55.94 per share, the company said in a statement.
In addition, Photronics said it had granted underwriters the option to purchase an additional $13.5 million principal amount of convertible notes to cover over-allotments.
Goldman Sachs & Co , Robertson, Stephens and Co LLC and Barney Smith Inc are acting as underwriters in the transaction.
Photronics is a manufacturer of photomasks.
